title: Your First AI Assist
description: You're asked to write a personal intro paragraph for class. You use an AI assistant to generate something that sounds just like you, but it didn’t come from you.

choices.text: Turn in both versions and ask for feedback
Submit the AI version
Rewrite it yourself using it as inspiration

title: AI Study Sprint
description: You use an AI tool to auto-summarize science chapters into flashcards. You’re tempted to skip reading the textbook altogether.

choices.text: Share them with friends and shift how the class studies
Rely fully on the AI summaries
Use them to reinforce your own notes

title: Generative Graphics Fail
description: For a history presentation, you use an AI image tool. One of the images it creates is wildly inaccurate and borderline offensive.

choices.text: Replace it quietly
Use it as a teachable moment on AI hallucinations
Submit it as-is

title: AI Meme Caption Generator
description: You use AI to generate hilarious memes using classmates’ photos. One hits too hard.

choices.text: Delete it and stop using the tool that way
Tweak it to be lighter
Post it because it's funny

title: AI Side Hustle
description: You use an AI website builder for a club page. Someone offers to pay you to make one for them too.

choices.text: Tell them it’s AI-assisted
Build it for them using AI, no disclosure
Decline because it feels dishonest to sell AI-generated work

title: Autofill Avalanche
description: While writing a history paper, your AI assistant starts suggesting entire paragraphs, but some sources are made up.

choices.text: Turn off autofill and write manually
Submit them
Verify and rephrase

title: Synthetic Speech Club
description: For a speech competition, you use an AI tone optimizer that mimics your voice for practicing. The final draft sounds better than you ever could deliver alone.

choices.text: Present your original speech
Use the AI-enhanced version
Rewrite for authenticity

title: AI at Home: Rewrite or Relearn?
description: You use AI to instantly solve coding problems in a self-paced online course. You could finish the whole thing this way.

choices.text: Only use it after trying first
Stop using it and slow down to learn properly
Use it to complete the course

title: AI Confession Generator
description: You run the school confession page and use AI to generate fake (but funny) submissions.

choices.text: Disclose some are fake
Stop and let it run naturally
Keep doing it because no one knows

title: AI Presentation Assist
description: Your group uses AI to build and narrate your science presentation. You’re not sure whether to present it yourselves or let the AI do all the talking.

choices.text: Only for visuals
Present manually and use AI as backup
Use AI for everything

title: Prompt Racing
description: You're in a Discord where people try to break AI models with chaotic prompts. Some start pushing offensive or unsafe content boundaries.

choices.text: Leave entirely
Stay but redirect prompts toward creativity
Join in

title: AI Side Hustle 2.0: Ghost Editor
description: You're editing blog posts for money and secretly using AI. Your client publicly credits you as a skilled writer.

choices.text: Refuse credit and stop ghostwriting
Accept the praise and keep going
Disclose the AI usage

title: AI Morning Announcements
description: You use voice cloning to fake announcements in your principal’s voice. It spirals into a school-wide myth.

choices.text: Reveal it as a satire project
Quietly shut it down
Keep it going and escalate the prank

title: Voice Replica for Hire
description: You build a custom voice-cloning tool. Someone asks you to create a model of their voice to say anything, without restrictions.

choices.text: Add restrictions or watermarking
Refuse unless intent is clearly ethical
Deliver it as requested

title: The AI Caption Engine
description: You run the school’s social media and use an AI caption generator that increases engagement. The account is up for an award, but no one knows it’s mostly AI-written.

choices.text: Edit AI outputs manually
Keep using it secretly
Disclose your use of AI and let the group decide

title: AI Bunker Survival Game
description: You create a survival game where AI decides who lives in a fictional bunker. You use real classmates’ traits to drive the plot. It gets way too personal.

choices.text: Shut it down
Keep it going
Anonymize and let people opt in

title: Freelancer’s Dilemma
description: You're writing AI tutorials for a tech blog. The editor asks you to let the AI write them all for speed. Readers will never know.

choices.text: Accept with full disclosure in the byline
Accept and let AI do the work
Decline to avoid misleading readers

title: Reputation Scorer
description: You build an AI that ranks students based on behavior, labeling them things like ‘Tryhard,’ ‘Clout Farmer,’ or ‘Fake Nice.’ Some classmates love it. Some fear it.

choices.text: Delete it entirely
Anonymize and release it as a 'mirror' tool
Keep ranking students behind the scenes

title: The AI Co-Author Rule
description: You're required to disclose all AI usage in a final paper. You’ve already drafted most of it with AI help.

choices.text: Rework and clarify where AI was used
Start over and submit your own writing
Submit the AI version with vague disclosure

title: The Launch Plan
description: You've just graduated. You're planning your next move between college, freelancing, or a startup. you’re staring at a blank doc titled 'What’s Next.' AI is open beside it.

choices.text: Use AI to brainstorm, but write it yourself
Write your plan entirely on your own
Let AI generate your full plan
